intro: Polanisia dianthera var. delagoensis, commonly known as the Delagoensis polanisia, is a rare and striking plant native to the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its unique, showy inflorescences. The plant features bright yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, often with a distinctive red or orange calyx. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is typically found in forest understories. Due to its rarity and ornamental value, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
